subject: Re: JUnit 4.1 fails AllTests with 2 errors
msgSnippet: Thank you. I ve begun playing with JUnit so I ve already started on option 1. I ll see what I can do with option 2. So far, whatever caused the AllTests
messageBody:
Thank you. I've begun "playing" with JUnit so I've already started
on option 1. I'll see what I can do with option 2.

So far, whatever caused the AllTests failures doesn't seem to be
interfering with my tests.

RK Henry

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Robert,
>
> The JUnit self-tests make an attempt to execute JUnit on the
command
> line to make sure that the correct exit code is returned. It
appears
> that something in your configuration is causing all of these
> command-line executions to fail. This most likely is a conflict
between
> your Java configuration and JUnit's self-test framework, and will
likely
> not prevent you from using JUnit for your own tests. You have two
options:
>
> 1) Ignore the error and get started.
> 2) Help us out, by setting a breakpoint at
TextRunnerTest.execTest.
> Figure out what command it's trying to run, and see if it works on
a
> separate command line. This will help to pinpoint the problem.
>
> Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
> robertkhenry wrote:
> > I'm trying to get started with JUnit 4.1. After installing
JUnit, I
> > typed the recommended command:
> >
> > "java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore org.junit.tests.AllTests"
> >
> > The instructions say that this should result in an "OK" message.
I'm
> > getting this result:
> >
> > FAILURES!!!
> > Tests run: 261, Failures: 2
> >
> > I'm including the exception stack below.
> >
> > Java is running on Windows XP,
> > java version "1.5.0_07"
> > Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_07-
b03)
> > Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_07-b03, mixed mode,
sharing)
> >
> > What am I overlooking?
> >
> > RK Henry
